snippet: Michele Fiore, a conservative Republican Nevada assembly member, emerged as the calm mediator in the final hours of an occupation of an Oregon wildlife refuge.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation official credits Republican Nevada Assembly member Michele Fiore with providing significant assistance in peacefully ending standoff between federal agents and occupiers of Malheur Federal Wildlife Refuge in Oregon; in final hours of 40-day siege, Fiore spoke with occupiers over phone and convinced them that FBI would not try to kill them all if they would emerge to surrender without their weapons.

byline.original: By KIRK JOHNSON, JULIE TURKEWITZ and MIKE McPHATE
byline.contributor: Kirk Johnson reported from Seattle, Julie Turkewitz from Denver, and Mike McPhate from New York. Dave Seminara contributed reporting from Burns, Ore.

lead_paragraph: Michele Fiore, a conservative Republican Nevada assembly member, emerged as the calm mediator in the final hours of an occupation of an Oregon wildlife refuge.

headline.main: Unlikely Peacemaker, Michele Fiore, Helps End Oregon Standoff
